p: Among the non-enzymatic antioxidants parameters, the levels of total phenolic content, total flavonoid content, and free radical scavenging capacity (DPPH) were measured in the study and the data in Table 6 show significant contents of TPC and TFC and DPPH capacity in three studied EOs. The highest content from total phenol and total flavonoid was 31.4 mg GAE/g and 17.6 mg QE/g in basil EOs. Additionally, a maximum DPPH capacity 18.9% was reported in basil essential oil.
